column2: Templar orders are martial groups dedicated to upholding the doctrine and values of a specific religion.
A gnomish form of government, technocracies are democratic and value technical skill above all else.
The Kirin Tor is the government of the city-state of Dalaran and is a magocracy lead by a council of six archmages.
The hosts of the Old Gods' original minions care little for social organizations, preferring to consume all in their path in order to hasten the Hour ofTwilight
Demons are either born from, or beings corrupted by, the fel energies of the Twisting Nether, and, like it, seek to consume or twist all life with a near-religious zeal.
The Infinite Dragonflight will, very rarely, attempt to meddle with the timeline.
The Infinite Dragonflight will act more often.
Infinite dragons won't appear outside extremely specific circumstances

Certain religions have specific requirements, and the religion of characters may be modified as needed.
With a few exceptions, there is no restriction on religion.
Certain governments have specific requirements, and the government of characters may be modified as needed.
The restrictions on governments are more relaxed.
Certain cultures have specific requirements, and the culture of characters may be modified as needed.
With a few exceptions, there is no restriction on culture.
Corruption happens at half the default speed.
Corruption happens at twice the default speed.
Classes are restricted to specific races and/or religions.
Classes have no race or religion requirements.
Certain characters will react positively or negatively towards members of certain classes.
Opinions will not change based on a character's class. Specific classes will also never be persecuted.
It is in sacred areas such as these that the tribe's religious cerimonies are performed.

Orcs have always traditionally organized themselves into clans, living a martial lifestyle in pursuit of honour and the approval of their ancestors. To be cast out from one's clan is seen with horror by all orcs, and is perhaps the greatest punishment amongst them.

Ogres are brutish creatures noted for being, generally, rather dim. They make up for it, however, in sheer size, strength and adaptability. Most ogres respect strength above all, but the rare ogre magi are, when they rise power, exceptionally cunning and capable rulers.

There are times when an ogre magi manages to unite many tribes and ogre mounds, forming cities instead guarded not by assorted brutes, but legions, and ruled not by whomever is biggest and loudest, but by a magocratic caste of ogre magi.

Incapable of reproducing and free of the needs of a mortal life, the Forsaken organize themselves in a slightly twisted version of the organization they took part in life. When dynasties no longer mean anything, the focus on personal prestige becomes paramount.

The Scourge is more akin to a swarm than an actual government. Though there are many autonomous members of it, they are all directly linked to their undying master and can receive orders from the Frozen Throne instantly.
Many worgen give in to their feral and wild natures, overcome by the fury within them. They form in packs not unlike those of wolves, and ravage the land.
Fel Wastelands can slowly be purified.
